definition: to have a taut face/to pull a long face/to look displeased
variant of 繃|绷[beng1]/variant of 繃|绷[beng3]
to draw tight/to stretch taut/to tack (with thread or pin)/embroidery hoop/woven bed mat
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: 110111You're calling him a beacon of social democracy, with a straight face?
sentences.chinese: 你绷着脸称他为社会民主主义的灯塔？

sentences.english: You're calling him a beacon of social democracy, with a straight face?
sentences.chinese: 你绷着脸称他为社会民主主义的灯塔？
怎么样呢？”汤姆绷着脸说。

sentences.english: Freddie stared sullenly at his younger brother.
sentences.chinese: 弗烈特绷着脸愠怒地瞪着他弟弟。

sentences.english: But can anyone, at this point, make those claims with a straight face?
sentences.chinese: 但是，在这一点上，有谁能绷着脸做出这样的断言。

sentences.english: He kept a straight face and remained speechless.
I saw the boss going about the office with a long face.
sentences.chinese: 我看见老板绷着脸在办公室里走来走去。

sentences.english: He plumped up his cheeks in an expression of annoyance.

definition: to put on a straight, stern or blank face/to put on a poker face
see 嬉皮笑臉|嬉皮笑脸[xi1 pi2 xiao4 lian3]
to put on a fake smile (idiom)/to smile insincerely
